channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bollard knocked over on Poverest Road near junction with Church Hill Road, 6th January
item.description:
This bollard was damaged over the Christmas period

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 193, Poverest Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 51.547469,-0.186806 .. https://w3w.co/spun.undulation.mobile, 6th January
item.description:
There is an electrical cabinet that's open looked damaged door. has consumer unit/sockets /traffic light controls wired that are live at 230v (there was blinking lights on so I know it's live ) I'm disabled. I was not able to secure it. I did put some insulation tape round it and ties the ends together. (To wet and cold for the tape to stick So used as rope) So the door is not swinging open. I don't know if this is council or private land. Could you please send someone out to screw it shut ASAP. I'm worried a kid will get a shock I did best I could
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flag on lamp post just below the light, 6th January
item.description:
This is the second flag to go up on this post and this time it’s right underneath the light. This causes a problem because the light flickers into my bedroom making a light show. Sometimes it triggers my cctv camera to go off as well because of the gigantic shadow it produces. I did report this last year but nothing has been done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frinsted Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 10 Abbots Place, 6th January
item.description:
Street light cover removed hanging loose please fix asap dangerous children walk past to and from school electric cables fuses visible removed on Sunday night by drug users
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Abbot's Place, South Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamp post 6 and s5 at the intersection of Kingsley Road with Priory Park Road, 6th January
item.description:
The light marked as s5 where Kingsley Road intersects Priory Park Road has not been lit since the end of November. Given that also the adjacent lamp post at the bottom of Kingsley road marked as 6 is not lit that corner of the road is completely dark after sundown. This situation has instigated more fly-tipping.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Priory Park Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 6th January
item.description:
No tax or MOT just left in street

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Canada Road, Slade Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leak onto pathway, 6th January
item.description:
This sewerage leak has been ongoing for over a year. It’s dangerous, smells really bad and goes right across the path at the bottom. No one should have to walk through this. It is now icing over because of the cold weather. There doesn’t seem to have been any attempt to rectify the problem. Can this be investigated and resolved please. Animals could walk through this as well and get ill.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bronze Age Way, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Freezer left abandoned, 6th January
item.description:
A tenant has left a freezer abandoned on the stairwell it’s filthy and dangerous to leave so long. Please can someone remove it please. It’s located at the entrance with no left on the 1st floor blocking the hydrant.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): New North Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Tree fallen and left lying across pavement, 6th January
item.description:
Hi hope you’re well. A small fallen tree is lying in across a space between two buildings, some of it is lying in the private hedge space but some of it is protruding into the pavement, it’s a tripping hazard. Please could you dispose of the tree? Thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Drysdale Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned furniture William Rushbrooke House, 6th January
item.description:
There is an abandoned couch next to the main entrance of flat 1-15 William Rushbrooke House (SE163YB) and it's been there for over 5 days. There is also some abandoned pieces of furniture on the other main entrance (flat 16-30) of William Rushbrooke House (SE163YB)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Linsey Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping in garage council owned, 6th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ravine Grove, Plumstead

item.title: Furniture flytipping in communal areas of the block, 6th January
item.description:
Unknown resident of the block in Olney Road (flats 145-183) left furnitures under the stairs on the ground floor near the entrance. I noticed it when coming back from work at around 6pm. Don't know what time it was dumped there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Olney Road, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
